title: Please help me with a book recommendation
content:
Can you please recommend one that covers the history of alphabets, writing, printing etc.

Thank you.

 [‹ Great typography in the Washington Post :-/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222533/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42746 "Go to previous forum topic") [A sans to pair with Filosofia? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222533/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42809 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Christopher Dean

comments.content:
I have one but it’s in Italian, the title is at the very bottom of this page :  
 [http://www.gregorietti.it/GROU.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222533/http:/www.gregorietti.it/GROU.html "http://www.gregorietti.it/GROU.html")

Warren Chappell’s [_A Short History of the Printed Word_](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222533/http:/www.amazon.com/Short-History-Printed-Word/dp/0881791547/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1204733673&sr=8-1) is really good but it covers only the printing period. It was updated by Robert Bringhurst.

On a much more “calligraphic” or writing approach, George Jean’s [_L’Écriture mémoire des hommes_](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706222533/http:/www.amazon.com/Lecriture-Memoire-Archeologie-Georges-Jean/dp/207053040X/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1204733772&sr=1-1) is really good, if you understand French. It was republished by Gallimard in 2007.
Check Google Books and Microsoft Books for Mason’s _History of the Art of Writing. It’s very old and very thorough._
